item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Simi? What was it you told me once about families? We have three kinds of family. Those we are born to, those who are born to us, and those we let into our hearts." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Alan Bradley
Kelly add a quote by Carrie Ryan (The Forest of Hands and Teeth)
item.description: "But then I'm distracted by movement in the Forest, a glimpse of red at the edge of my vision. She's no longer running, no longer even walking or standing, but crawling now. Dragging her broken body across the ground toward me, her fingers clawing at the dirt. Her progress is slow, unbearably so. Such that it's almost sad to see her reduced to this. Her body has used up it's stores of energy and has begun collapsing in on itself." -- Carrie Ryan (The Forest of Hands and Teeth)

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by A. Lee Martinez
item.description: "In the middle of nowhere, along a quiet stretch of road, the diner dreamt of the hungry dead. And of two men." -- A. Lee Martinez

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kim Harrison
item.description: "A slow smile curved over my face, and I leaned down over him. "No," I said. "Wishes are lies. Tell me you're going to leave. Tell me you're not going to stay. Tell me that it's only for a while so I can enjoy today," I whispered in his ear, as if saying it louder would break me. "And when you go, don't think me cold when I don't cry. I can't cry anymore, Pierce. It hurts too much." -- Kim Harrison

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Carrie Ryan
item.description: "They're endless, stretching beyond the horizon and spreading around me like forever. They heave and moan, frothing over each other, cresting and falling. The pure depth and vastness of it all beyond comprehension, my eyes unable to focus on any individual. Instead I'm drowned in their need. They ripple and swell, the bodies of the Mudo, like the ocean. Like the dead-tossed waves." -- Carrie Ryan

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Richelle Mead
item.description: "I’d said it before and meant it: Alive or undead, the love of my life was a badass." -- Richelle Mead

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "It's not fair to show someone the sun and then banish him from it. Even the devil may cry when he looks around hell and realizes that he's there alone. -Acheron" -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "It's easy to look at people and make quick judgments about them, their present and their past, but you'd be amazed at the pain and tears a single smile hides. What a person shows to the world is only one tiny facet of the iceberg hidden from sight. And more often then not, it's lined with cracks and scars that go all the way to the foundation of their soul." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelley Armstrong
item.description: "Kids who don't eavesdrop on adult conversations are doomed to a childhood of ignorance." -- Kelley Armstrong

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "One must always be careful of books," said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Stacia Kane
item.description: "Terrible thought she was brave. She remembered it now, heard his voice in her head as if he stood next to her. "They scared. Not you, though." Terrible thought she was brave, and if he - a man whose name was Terrible, a man whose path people scrambled to get out of - thought so, it must be true. She could do this, she would do this." -- Stacia Kane

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Good and evil are merely opposite sides of a coin. Get tossed in the air enough, it's easy to come down on the wrong side." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Kelley Armstrong
item.description: "He pivoted, gaze following me as I crossed to the shower and turned on the cold water, so it would drown out our conversation without steaming up the room. Great," he muttered."Now they're going to think we're showering together. Maybe we can just tell them we were washing off the crawl space dirt and trying to conserve water." -- Kelley Armstrong

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Moira Rogers
item.description: "That was… I don’t even know what that was.” Derek’s voice was nothing more than a rasping whisper. “That was making love, dirty style." -- Moira Rogers

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Patricia Briggs
item.description: "MS. THOMPSON, it said in heavy block letters, PLEASE KEEP YOUR FELINE OFF MY PROPERTY. IF I SEE IT AGAIN, I WILL EAT IT." -- Patricia Briggs

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "The alley and the music all fell away, and there was nothing but her and the rain and Jace, his hands on her. . . He made a noise of surprise, low in his throat, and dug his fingers into the thin fabric of her tights. Not unexpectedly, they ripped, and his wet fingers were suddenly on the bare skin of her legs. Not to be outdone, Clary slid her hands under the hem of his soaked shirt, and let her fingers explore what was underneath: the tight, hot skin over his ribs, the ridges of his abdomen, the scars on his back. This was uncharted territory for her, but it seemed to be driving him crazy: he was moaning softly against her mouth, kissing her harder and harder, as if it would never be enough, not quite enough —" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Or maybe it's just that beautiful things are so easily broken by the world." -- Cassandra Clare
